intro: Hesperis caucasica, commonly known as Caucasian honesty, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, white or pale purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, round seed pods that split open when mature. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Hesperis caucasica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in gardens with full sun.
